main

Class GameLogic

  • java.lang.Object
    • main.GameLogic

  • public class GameLogic
extends java.lang.Object
    Analyzes the current game map and performs calculations for running the game; TERMINOLOGY USED IN THIS CLASS 1) enemy spread - an event where the enemies in each hostile cell spread to one random cell that is one step away; each enemy spread is accompanied by objectives regenerating their enemies; occurs at different times depending on the difficulty of the current game; 2) step - see explanation below Throughout this class I will use a term called "steps". A step is simply the distance from one cell to another. A step can be horizontal or vertical. To find the number of steps from one cell to another, count from the 1st cell's row to the 2nd cell's row and then to the 2nd cell's column. 
     In the figure below: the distance from [a] to [b] or [e] is 1 step; the
 distance from [a] to [i], [f], or [c] is 2 steps; the distance from [a] to
 [m], [d], [j], or [g] is 3 steps; the distance from [a] to [k] is 4 steps;
 the distance from [a] to [p] is 6 steps.
 
 [a][b][c][d] 
 [e][f][g][h] 
 [i][j][k][l] 
 [m][n][o][p]
    Author:
    Stanton Parham (stparham@ncsu.edu)

      • withinOneStep

        public static boolean withinOneStep(GameCell GC1,
                                    GameCell GC2)
        Determines if the two passed in cells are within one step of each other;
        Parameters:
        GC1 - the first cell to be compared
        GC2 - the second cell to be compared
        Returns:
        whether or no the cells are within one step of each other

      • bombardCell

        public boolean bombardCell(int bombardCost,
                           boolean tutorialMode)
        Performs all the game logic related to bombarding (destroying) a cell;
        Parameters:
        bombardCost - the intensity of the bombardment based on the number of energy cores that the player decided to use when bombarding
        tutorialMode - whether or not the tutorial is taking place (wherever tutorialMode is seen it means that it is needed to ensure that the tutorial does not change the player's resources, captured cells, or other stats before the game even starts)
        Returns:
        whether or not the cell was able to be bombarded based on the player's resources

      • build

        public boolean build(java.lang.String option,
                     boolean tutorialMode)
        Performs all of the game logic dealing with building a structure on a cell;
        Parameters:
        option - the type of structure being built on the cell
        tutorialMode - whether or not the tutorial is taking place (wherever tutorialMode is seen it means that it is needed to ensure that the tutorial does not change the player's resources, captured cells, or other stats before the game even starts)
        Returns:
        whether or not the structure was able to be built based on the player's resources

      • captureCell

        public boolean captureCell(boolean tutorialMode)
        Performs all game logic related to capturing a cell;
        Parameters:
        tutorialMode - whether or not the tutorial is taking place (wherever tutorialMode is seen it means that it is needed to ensure that the tutorial does not change the player's resources, captured cells, or other stats before the game even starts)
        Returns:
        whether or not the cell was able to be captured based on the player's resources

      • changeStationedSoldiers

        public boolean changeStationedSoldiers(int value,
                                       boolean tutorialMode)
        Sets the number of stationed soldiers in the active cell to the passed in value;
        Parameters:
        value - the desired number of stationed soldiers
        tutorialMode - whether or not the tutorial is taking place (wherever tutorialMode is seen it means that it is needed to ensure that the tutorial does not change the player's resources, captured cells, or other stats before the game even starts)
        Returns:
        whether or not the the desired number of soldiers could be stationed

      • endGame

        public void endGame(char option)
        Ends the game logically and tells the game UI to bring up the end game pane;
        Parameters:
        option - the type of end game that occurred: 'W' means the player won by capturing all 3 objectives 'L' means the player lost because the enemies captured the Space Port 'F' means the player forfeited by bombarding their own Space Port
